body: What is the meaning of "the P2PKH address of the hd master key"? Why would someone need this?
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<addr>\",    (string) the P2PKH address of the hd master key\n"

body: utACK xpriv changes

Extended keys are mostly not P2PKH encoded (they have their "own encoding format"). But here we print the masterkey**id**. A P2PKH address should be okay for this case, but we should label it as P2PKH.
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<addr>\",    (string) the P2PKH address of the hd master key\n"

body:
I disagree with identifying it as a P2PKH address. It is not intended to
receive money with, so it should not be made to look like an address.
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<addr>\",    (string) the P2PKH address of the hd master key\n"

body: @jonasschnelli I think it is good to split off this change to another pull, as it seems too controversial.
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<addr>\",    (string) the P2PKH address of the hd master key\n"

body:
The problem is, we store the `masterkeyid` as a `CKeyID`. IMO to get the xpub (base58 check encoded extended public key) we need to have a unlocked wallet.
@sipa: What would you propose instead? Caching the xpub in a separate wallet.dat record type?
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<addr>\",    (string) the P2PKH address of the hd master key\n"

body:
You can use something else than xpub, no? Just don't make it look like an
address...

body: Changed the masterkey-ID from P2PKH to a plain hex of the Hash160.
Nit: comment still says addr

body: Fixed @MarcoFalke 's nits.

Salvagewallet will change the master key every time, it seems:

```
$ src/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=/tmp -usehd=1 -salvagewallet & sleep 1 && src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/tmp getwalletinfo |grep masterkey && src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/tmp stop
[1] 11947
  "masterkeyid": "644ee9e35c0e9308314038b328502c4babf8b048"
Bitcoin server stopping
$ src/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=/tmp -usehd=1 -salvagewallet & sleep 1 && src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/tmp getwalletinfo |grep masterkey && src/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/tmp stop
[1] 12048
  "masterkeyid": "a05bf6edf3738121ba19c72779c71c697ce394cb"
Bitcoin server stopping
@MarcoFalke: `-salvagewallet` only recovers private keys. It will recover your seed, but will not activate it. We might want to also try to recover the metadata which key is used as hd seed...
I think this is already merged. Needs rebase
diff_hunk:
@@ -2190,6 +2190,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<hash160>\", (string) the Hash160 of the hd master pubkey\n"

body: Rebased and fixed nits.
Fixed rebase issue (`const CHDChain& GetHDChain()` was defined twice).

"Implementation looks really clean and simple, and like it should compile ACK" d07513c 
That's right, not even a "concept ACK". But it doesn't look like I'll be against the concept once I put more time into understanding it either.

Tested ACK 0d17b08

* HD wallet dump before and after

```diff
--- /tmp/hd_old	2016-07-21 22:08:29.063603489 +0200
+++ /tmp/hd_new	2016-07-21 22:28:20.219771942 +0200

+++ /tmp/no_new	2016-07-21 22:28:42.492569385 +0200

 #   mined on 2011-02-02T23:16:42Z

Slightly updated to allow identifying old, non active master keys (currently useful after encrypting the wallet).
Also added the keypath in the comment section of each key.

Example of an encrypted wallet done with #8389:
```
